reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 158/03: CERTIFICATION OF RECORDINGS AND TRANSCRIPTS
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 158/03: CERTIFICATION OF RECORDINGS AND TRANSCRIPTS

content.content: 1. This Regulation applies to proceedings in the Court of Appeal, the Superior Court of Justice and the Ontario Court of Justice.  O. Reg. 158/03, s. 1.
content.raw_html: 1. This Regulation applies to proceedings in the Court of Appeal, the Superior Court of Justice and the Ontario Court of Justice.  O. Reg. 158/03, s. 1.

content.content: 2. In this Regulation, “approved device” means a device for recording sound of a type approved by the Attorney General, as mentioned in subsection 5 (1) of the Act.  O. Reg. 158/03, s. 2.
content.raw_html:
2. In this Regulation,

“approved device” means a device for recording sound of a type approved by the Attorney General, as mentioned in subsection 5 (1) of the Act.  O. Reg. 158/03, s. 2.

content.content: 3. (1) A recording made under subsection 5 (1) of the Act by means of an approved device shall be certified in Form 1 by a person who, (a) is authorized to record evidence and proceedings under subsection 5 (1) of the Act; and (b) is in charge of the approved device while the recording is being made.  O. Reg. 158/03, s. 3 (1); O. Reg. 109/11, s. 1. (2) The certificate in Form 1 is admissible in evidence and is proof, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, that the recording is a recording of evidence and proceedings in the proceeding.  O. Reg. 158/03, s. 3 (2); O. Reg. 109/11, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
3. (1) A recording made under subsection 5 (1) of the Act by means of an approved device shall be certified in Form 1 by a person who,

(a) is authorized to record evidence and proceedings under subsection 5 (1) of the Act; and

(b) is in charge of the approved device while the recording is being made.  O. Reg. 158/03, s. 3 (1); O. Reg. 109/11, s. 1.

(2) The certificate in Form 1 is admissible in evidence and is proof, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, that the recording is a recording of evidence and proceedings in the proceeding.  O. Reg. 158/03, s. 3 (2); O. Reg. 109/11, s. 1.

content.content:
